attributes.action: Stockton council to Continue to fund 55 SEN places at whitehouse primary school
attributes.additional_details: The school to date has 55 SEN places to which the council have decided to reduce each year till they have zero. This will result in the SEN children losing the additional resources the currently have and use.
attributes.background: I am a parent of a child benifiting from a SEN placement the council are reducing funding for within whitehouse primary school. This is an outstanding mainstream school with the additional needs to help gain a great education and we need your help to fight against the decision the council has made

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council - you can find out more here: 

http://egenda.stockton.gov.uk/elps/
